messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1383
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/25/01 6:52:43 PM Mountain Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/25/01 6:52:43 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< I can really relate to this.... I spent so much time at the headmaster's
office for "talking too much" I spent so much time in comprehensive school
(high school to Americans) writing lines ("I will not disrupt the class by
talking so much)", so many hours sitting outside the classroom for "talking
too much", many report cards that said "Dawn talks too much and dispruts
other people: ( >>


Made me remember all the sentence writing after school and the eraser
clapping for being a disruptive child. Also the principle coming onto the bus
to have a talk w/ me and putting myself and my best friend in front seats. I
did get thrown off the bus a few times eventually. I lived in detention too.
Mostly for being late,"how are you ever going to hold a job when you grow
up?" I'd love to let them know that I was rarely if ever late for work in my
various occupations. Jerks!

NICKI~
